fetchObjectsOnly.title: Fetch Database Object Names and Schemas Only?
fetchObjectsOnly.description: Set to true to refresh (or fetch for the first time) database objects and schema options. NOTE: This step is necessary before first execution; setting to true does NOT run the extraction

host.title: MySQL Host
host.description: The host name or IP for your MySQL instance or cluster

port.title: Port
port.description: The port on which the MySQL database accepts connections, the default port is 3306

databases.title: MySQL Database(s)
databases.description: MySQL Database(s) to Extract. If left empty, all non-system databases are pulled

username.title: Username
username.description: The Keboola user configured for your MySQL database, for use only with your extractor

#password.title: Password
#password.description: Strong password you set for your Keboola MySQL user

runIncrementalSync.title: Run Incremental Sync?
runIncrementalSync.description: Keep true to run incremental sync based on prior state (for all tables in your mappings specification where you have chosen incremental or log_based. If false, prior state is ignored and full database sync is run

storageMappingsFile.title: Output Storage Mappings File Name
storageMappingsFile.description: The name of the output file (no extension necessary) for the YAML mappings in Keboola Storage

inputMappingsJson.title: Table Mappings JSON Specification
inputMappingsJson.description: The JSON config for the tables, columns and corresponding replication methods to sync (see config documentation on how to do so)

ssl.title: Use SSL?
ssl.description: Keep true to run incremental sync with SSL, uses self-signed certificate unless SSL Certificate Authority parameter is specified

sslCa.title: SSL Certificate Authority (CA)
sslCa.description: Name of certificate authority implemented, if any (i.e. IdenTrust). If not specified, self-signed certificate is used

verifyCert.title: Verify Server SSL Certificate?
verifyCert.description: Keep true to connect to MySQL with verify mode set to true, which verifies the server and certificate

sshTunnel.title: Use SSH Tunnel?
sshTunnel.description: Set to true to connect using a configured SSH tunnel, otherwise keep false and be sure you have whitelisted Keboola's IPs. If false, other SSH parameters will be ignored and are not necessary.

sshHost.title: SSH Host
sshHost.description: The host name or host IP associated with your SSH server (Note: Don't use load balancer as host)

sshUser.title: SSH Username
sshUser.description: The SSH User for connecting to your SSH server

sshPort.title: SSH Port
sshPort.description: The SSH server's port number, the default port is 22

sshPublicKey.title: SSH Server Public Key
sshPublicKey.description: The public key for the key pair associated with your SSH server

#sshBase64PrivateKey.title: Base64-Encoded SSH Server Private Key
#sshBase64PrivateKey.description: The base64-encoded private key for the key pair associated with your SSH server (encrypted and secured)

outputBucket.title: Output Bucket Destination
outputBucket.description: (Optional) The name of bucket in Keboola storage where the data. Keboola will create a bucket for you if not specified
